snippet: Parisians who went out on Friday night to listen to music, watch soccer, or enjoy a meal or drink with friends, quickly became engulfed in a blood-soaked drama.
abstract: Witnesses describe lack of comprehension during string of terrorist attacks targeting random victims in ordinary places across Paris; attacks, while arbitrary in the victims they targeted, were coordinated and apparently carried out by well-equipped and trained militants.

byline.original: By ANDREW HIGGINS and MILAN SCHREUER
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Liz Alderman, Lilia Blaise, Dan Bilefsky, Sam Borden, Aurelien Breeden, Nicola Clark and Rachel Donadio.

lead_paragraph: Parisians who went out on Friday night to listen to music, watch soccer, or enjoy a meal or drink with friends, quickly became engulfed in a blood-soaked drama.

headline.main: Attackers in Paris ‘Did Not Give Anybody a Chance’
headline.print_headline: ‘They Did Not Give Anybody a Chance’
